page.title: 20A Dairy Farm
page.content: I live at 'Oaklands Farm', St. Lawrence, it is a 150 years old. We have seventeen cows and the oldest two are about ten years old. I have a cow called 'Stardust' and a calf called 'Superstar' of my own. 'Stardust' has won a cup and trophy for being the island champion in the Island Cattle Show. My dad gets up to milk at about 5.45 a.m. in summer and 7.00 a.m. in winter. The cows stay out at night except when they are calving. Nowadays my dad milks by milking machine. During milking they have bran nuts as a meal. It helps to stop them kicking. The milk is tipped into a bulk tank and is later pumped into the milk tanker lorry and taken to the Dairy at Five Oaks to be processed in to four grades of milk, cream, butter and yoghurt. Jersey milk is very rich and high in butter fat.
